artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Kobayashi Tetsujirō; Carver: Muneoka Nobukichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 460.7; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 278.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; figure with long hair and foreshortened face, wearing grey and white garment with blue sleeves, holding a man by the throat who falls on his back, and holding a dagger in PR hand; falling man, with toes splayed on PR foot, wears white and blue pants and dark blue blouse with red, green and yellow square patterns, and has long black hair and bushy beard; vase of flowers at left
markings: Artist’s seal: 号魁斎 {Gō Kaisai} | Carver’s seal: 彫工宗岡 {horikō Muneoka}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Yoshitoshi's Unsurpassed Warriors (Yoshitoshi musha burui 芳年武者旡類)
title: Yamato Takeru Mikoto and Kawakami Takeru
